topics.body:
One time in highschool, our history teacher, the same one who knows Latin and gave me my nickname, left us a quiz to answer. She wasn't actually there when we came in, just left the papers on the table and placed a note saying for us to answer it. Right about the end of the period she shows up, thankfully everyone's done. Then our resident Chink makes an awesome comeback.

Teacher: So how did you find the test?
Part-Chinese friend: Oh that was easy, we found them on the table.

Everyone laughed.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/546d51fc63687226c5280100#post_546d51fc63687226c5280100

"The pineal gland, also known as the pineal body, conarium or epiphysis cerebri, is a small endocrine gland in the vertebrate brain. It produces DMT and [1] melatonin, a serotonin derived hormone, which affects the modulation of sleep patterns in both seasonal and circadian rhythms.[2][3] Its shape resembles a tiny pine cone (hence its name), and it is located in the epithalamus, near the center of the brain, between the two hemispheres, tucked in a groove where the two halves of the thalamus join."


the pineal gland is normally associated with the opening of the "third eye" and the receptor of it

nobody knows how he got god tier, the narrator, or the trolls, nor the kids, nobody knows how he got fake god tier, but he did.[/spoiler]
